strategy: Use CatBoost with the following settings: iterations=500, learning_rate=0.03, depth=6. For preprocessing, fill numeric NaN values with the median and drop columns with more than 50% missing values. Do not use get_dummies for categorical columns; instead, pass the cat_features parameter to CatBoost. If you encounter a dtype error, cast categorical columns to strings before passing them to the model.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from catboost import CatBoostRegressor

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
validation = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train['SalePrice']
X_val = validation.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_val = validation['SalePrice']
X_test = test.drop(['Id'], axis=1)

# Identify categorical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Fill NaN in numeric columns with median
for col in numeric_columns:
    if X_train[col].isna().sum() > 0:
        X_train[col].fillna(X_train[col].median(), inplace=True)
        X_val[col].fillna(X_val[col].median(), inplace=True)
        X_test[col].fillna(X_test[col].median(), inplace=True)

# Fill NaN in categorical columns with mode
for col in categorical_columns:
    mode_val = X_train[col].mode()[0] if not X_train[col].mode().empty else 'Unknown'
    X_train[col].fillna(mode_val, inplace=True)
    X_val[col].fillna(mode_val, inplace=True)
    X_test[col].fillna(mode_val, inplace=True)

# Convert categorical columns to string (in case of dtype issues)
for col in categorical_columns:
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].astype(str)
    X_val[col] = X_val[col].astype(str)
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].astype(str)

# Drop columns with more than 50% missing values
missing_ratio_train = X_train.isnull().mean()
missing_ratio_test = X_test.isnull().mean()
cols_to_drop = missing_ratio_train[missing_ratio_train > 0.5].index.tolist()
X_train = X_train.drop(cols_to_drop, axis=1)
X_val = X_val.drop(cols_to_drop, axis=1)
X_test = X_test.drop(cols_to_drop, axis=1)

# Define cat_features for CatBoost
cat_features = [col for col in X_train.columns if X_train[col].dtype == 'object']

# Initialize and train CatBoost

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from catboost import CatBoostRegressor

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
validation = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train['SalePrice']
X_val = validation.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_val = validation['SalePrice']
X_test = test.drop(['Id'], axis=1)

# Identify categorical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Fill NaN in numeric columns with median
for col in numeric_columns:
    if X_train[col].isna().sum() > 0:
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna(X_train[col].median())
        X_val[col] = X_val[col].fillna(X_val[col].median())
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna(X_test[col].median())

# Fill NaN in categorical columns with mode
for col in categorical_columns:
    mode_val = X_train[col].mode()[0] if not X_train[col].mode().empty else 'Unknown'
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna(mode_val)
    X_val[col] = X_val[col].fillna(mode_val)
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna(mode_val)

# Convert categorical columns to string (in case of dtype issues)
for col in categorical_columns:
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].astype(str)
    X_val[col] = X_val[col].astype(str)
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].astype(str)

# Drop columns with more than 50% missing values
missing_ratio_train = X_train.isnull().mean()
missing_ratio_test = X_test.isnull().mean()
cols_to_drop = missing_ratio_train[missing_ratio_train > 0.5].index.tolist()
X_train = X_train.drop(cols_to_drop, axis=1)
X_val = X_val.drop(cols_to_drop, axis=1)
X_test = X_test.drop(cols_to_drop, axis=1)

# Define cat_features for CatBoost
cat_features = [col for col in X_train.columns if X_train[col].dtype == 'object']

# Initialize and train CatBoost
